content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = String[]
    answers = String[]
    in_question = false
    in_answer = false

    for line in eachline(md)
        if startswith(line, "# Question")
            in_question = true
            continue
        end
        if startswith(line, "# Answer")
            in_answer = true
            continue
        end

        if in_question
            questions = add_to_array(line, questions)
            in_question = false
        end
        if in_answer
            answers = add_to_array(line, answers)
            in_answer = false
        end
    end

    return (strip.(questions)[1], strip.(answers)[1])
end

function add_to_array(line, arr)
    push!(arr, line)
    return arr
end
```

This function `q_and_a_extractor` takes a markdown-formatted text `md` as a string and extracts all text between `# Question` and `# Answer` sections. It strips leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text and returns a tuple containing the question and answer.
